And while Tenga have seriously upped their game and made a really fantastic toy, some of those gripes are still lingering. I just […]
item.content:encoded:
Flip 0

by Matthew Nolan on 03/28/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Penis Toys »
  • Review Comics

Flippin’ Heck, my previous Flip Hole review is more than 3 years old! How time flies when your jerking for comics!

Well I had some gripes about the Flip Hole back then. And while Tenga have seriously upped their game and made a really fantastic toy, some of those gripes are still lingering. I just can’t FEEL and separate out the sensations of each bump and lump well enough. It all feels same-y for me. But looking at other reviews – some people seem to REALLY dig just how soft it is. So maybe its just a dosn’t work for me-but-maybe-for-you sort of review.

Personally I’m not going to be reaching for this expensive toy often, and would encourage anyone shopping for a masturbation sleeve to see my other reviews first. There’s a lot of cheaper options that I think will treat your wang better. The Tenga Zero is like touching the future of sex toys, but I think, still isn’t worth that $100 entry fee. The zero might not be the willy hero you’re looking for.

Buy it from one of our Friends (With Benefits)

item.content:encoded:
Tiger

by Matthew Nolan on 03/21/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Dildos »
  • Review Comics »
  • Vibrators

And we’re back! Erika’s recovering from her month of hell. But we’re muscling up and getting back into the swing of things. Time to crunch out some reviews!

A few of you have asked us to cover some of these ribbed Fun Factory toys, like the Semilino and Stronic Drei. They sure are a visual delight – and heck Erika thinks they’re a good pick if you’re a person who NEEDS a lot of sensation on your dildo. But for her personally it just didn’t do the trick.

item.title: We-Vibe & App Privacy Issues
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Hi everybody. It’s been in the news lately that We-Vibe have been found guilty of tracking and using users’ sexual information through their more recently made app-enabled sex toys. While we haven’t had a chance to review one of the We-Vibe 4 Plus models, we have reviewed a few of We-Vibe’s other toys, so we […]
item.content:encoded:
We-Vibe & App Privacy Issues

by Matthew Nolan on 03/15/2017 at 11:30 am
Posted In: Blog

Hi everybody.

It’s been in the news lately that We-Vibe have been found guilty of tracking and using users’ sexual information through their more recently made app-enabled sex toys. While we haven’t had a chance to review one of the We-Vibe 4 Plus models, we have reviewed a few of We-Vibe’s other toys, so we felt it prudent to warn folks interested in picking up a more modern We-Vibe toy that their sexy-info might not be very secure!

We still love our old We-Vibe 2, the Tango, and more recently the Nova (which DOES have an app feature which we purposely didn’t use), and don’t think you should avoid any of them, they are GOOD toys. Instead what we’re recommending is to wait for We-Vibe to remedy their problem and just avoid the app features for your toys for right now – don’t let your We-Vibe connect to the internet!

It’s probably a handy idea to treat ALL your sex toys this way for a while too. I’ve a sneaky feeling it’s not JUST We-Vibe who’ve been lax in sex toy privacy security issues, and that the industry as a whole is going to go through a bit of a wake up. Apps are a fun feature that have never felt core to our sex toy experiences – we’re more interested in the rumble it brings to our jungle, rather than the stats or wireless features which always felt gimmicky, and I guess that would be my recommended take-away for you: If you’re interested in getting a sex toy, ignore the ‘app’ side of it and just consider the toy at face value. How’s it going to make my junk FEEL even if I don’t use the app?

Hope that helps! Stay safe everyone!

└ Tags: ap, app, news, privacy, security, we-vibe, wevibe

item.title: Puppy Play by Alex Reeder
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: And we’re back from ECCC! We had such a wonderful convention, thank you everybody for coming to visit and buying a book. It was such a wonderful and exhausting experience. Filling in for us as we recoup is the wonderful Alex Reeder and his comic on Puppy Play! We were so excited to get this […]
item.content:encoded:
Puppy Play by Alex Reeder

by Matthew Nolan on 03/14/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education »
  • Harnesses & Packing »
  • Kink & BDSM »
  • Kinks »
  • Sex & Sexuality

And we’re back from ECCC! We had such a wonderful convention, thank you everybody for coming to visit and buying a book. It was such a wonderful and exhausting experience.

Filling in for us as we recoup is the wonderful Alex Reeder and his comic on Puppy Play! We were so excited to get this look at a kink the both of us know so little about! That whole bit on it being meditative and helpful for a busy anxious mind? Sounds pretty wonderful to me. Anyway, drop Alex a visit and send them some much deserved love.

  • SFW Tumblr
  • NSFW Tumblr
  • Twitter
  • Patreon

Also if YOU’RE interested in diving into the Puppy Play scene, and are looking for some neat gear, let me recommend Stockroom as a good go-to, they pretty much have the market on good BDSM starter gear:

  • Stockroom
Stockroom ALSO has a 15% discount for you, just add ‘OHJOY’ at checkout!

item.title: Kupala Night by PannaN
item.dc:creator: Matthew Nolan
item.description: Im super excited to introduce you to PannaN and their comic on Kupala Night – a traditional mischievous night celebrated in Slavic Mythology and eastern Europe. I hadn’t heard anything about a sexy holiday night in the woods – so when PannanN came to us with this, I jumped at the chance – heck yeah […]
item.content:encoded:
Kupala Night by PannaN

by Matthew Nolan on 03/07/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Comic »
  • Education Comics »
  • Guest Comics »
  • Guest Education

Im super excited to introduce you to PannaN and their comic on Kupala Night – a traditional mischievous night celebrated in Slavic Mythology and eastern Europe.

I hadn’t heard anything about a sexy holiday night in the woods – so when PannanN came to us with this, I jumped at the chance – heck yeah I want to learn about a celebrated night of excuses-to-fornicate-in-the-woods! PannaN’s amazing art was just the cherry on top. I hope you all found it fun and informative – this is a REAL holiday and still some-what-differently is still celebrated every 6/7th of July!

  • Portfolio
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Tumblr
  • Slavonica Comic
└ Tags: celebration, education, festival, guest, guest comic, holiday, July, Kupala, Kupala night, PannaN

Emerald City Comicon

by Erika Moen on 02/24/2017 at 2:35 pm
Posted In: Blog


My Dearest Perverts! Matt and I’re gunna be at the Emerald City Comicon in Seattle from March 2-5th!

We’ll be tabling with Topatoco on the sky bridge at booth 1102 aaaaaand I’m gunna be on some panels and stuff too!

Thursday, March 2nd, 6:45-7:45 pm, room TCC 305:
Sex Education, Erotica, and Comics: A Discussion with Limerence Press

Friday, March 3rd, 3:15-3:30 pm, booth 216:
Signing at Oni Press/Limerence’s table!

Saturday, March 4th, 2 – 2:30 pm, booth 216:
Signing at Oni Press/Limerence’s table!

Saturday, March 4th, 6:30-7:30 pm, room TCC 305:
The New XXX; The Smut Comics Underground

Sunday, March 5th, 11:45am-12:00pm, ECCC Live Stage, Level 4 Skybridge Lobby
Interview on Twitch TV
Live-stream interview talking about Limerence Press. You can watch from home, even!

We’ll be selling our books (including our BRAND NEW coloring book!), stickers, and maybe even some of my embroideries??? Haha, who knows!

Anyway, I hope we see you there!

item.title: Hourly Comics Day, 2017
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.category: this comic took us two weeks to make
item.description: Here’s how my embroidery turned out! Every year Hourly Comics Day takes place on the 1st of February! It’s a fun way to share a small slice of life. As some of you know, autobio is where my heart lies. On the actual day, I only had time to jot down quick stick figures in […]
item.content:encoded:
Hourly Comics Day, 2017

by Erika Moen on 02/21/2017 at 12:01 am
  • Adventures »
  • Comic »
  • Favorites »
  • Interviews

Here’s how my embroidery turned out!


Every year Hourly Comics Day takes place on the 1st of February! It’s a fun way to share a small slice of life. As some of you know, autobio is where my heart lies. On the actual day, I only had time to jot down quick stick figures in my sketchbook and then I went back later and re-drew everything all nicely just for this update. Matt and I pulled out all the bells and whistles on this one, it took us almost 2 weeks to draw and color! I hope you all liked this honest look at my February 1st.

Check out some of our friends’ Hourlies too! Abby Howard, Lucy Bellwood, Lucky Knisley, Danielle Corsetto, Melanie Gillman, and here’s a great big list with loads more!

I also wanna take this moment to recommend the graphic novel Marbles by Ellen Forney. I read it before I was diagnosed as Bipolar II myself, but wow, did it reach out and grab me by the heart with how much I could relate to it. Maybe a year or so after it came out, I received my own diagnosis and it was like “Ooohhhhh…. No wonder.” I dunno, guys. I’m still learning a lot about my disorder, still learning how to best manage it and take care of myself. It’s hard work and I’m so, so, so grateful for the support network I have who looks out for me and loves all of me, including the crazy bits.

└ Tags: autobio, bipolar, bp, bpd, day to day, embroidery, erika at work, exhaustion, helioscope, Hourly, hours, mental health, mental illness, portland, studio, this comic took us two weeks to make

item.title: Nevertheless, she persisted
item.dc:creator: Erika Moen
item.description: If you follow my Instagram or Twitter, you’ve been exposed to my love of embroidery and progress pictures of my latest needlepoint projects. Just last night I started this new one, inspired by the quote “Nevertheless, she persisted“. If you’ve been following American politics, you know what that’s about ;) As soon as I heard […]
item.content:encoded:
Nevertheless, she persisted

by Erika Moen on 02/09/2017 at 10:23 am
Posted In: Blog


If you follow my Instagram or Twitter, you’ve been exposed to my love of embroidery and progress pictures of my latest needlepoint projects. Just last night I started this new one, inspired by the quote “Nevertheless, she persisted“. If you’ve been following American politics, you know what that’s about ;)


As soon as I heard that phrase, I knew I had to commit it to stitches– but the words by themselves, though powerful, looked a bit empty floating in space all alone. So then I thinks to myself, I thinks “What do I love to embroider? FLOWERS, motherfucker!” After considering a few different species known for their hardiness (Or should I say… their persistence?) I decided on the noble thistle. She’s tough as nails, has a plan, and will draw blood if you try to grab her with your bare hands. Yeah. The thistle is my flower of choice for this project.


I was super flattered to get several requests to share my design with my fellow embroidery enthusiasts! So yeah! I’mma do that! But first, I ask that you follow these instructions:

Instructions


1. Before downloading this pattern, you must donate at least $5 to International Women’s Health Coalition.
2. You will use this design for personal use only, not for profit or commercial use.

Ok! Once you’ve made your donation to IWHC, heeeeeere’s the PDF of the design!

I’m afraid I currently don’t have time to come up with a step-by-step guide for how to embroider this (I’m sorry! I’ve got a lot of dick comics to draw!), but here is a really basic suggested stitches model:

Resources


-How to transfer the design to your fabric.
-Stitches Used: Colonial Knot, Split stitch, Satin Stitch, and Long and Short stitch.

Good luck, all you persistent stitchers! I’ll be sharing my progress of this over on Twitter and Instagram :)

Update!


I finally finished it!
I did wind up deviating from my drawn design ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ Do what feels right for you!

└ Tags: embroider, embroidery, hoopart, needleart, nevertheless she persisted, pattern, thistle
